result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Shane D Hiley was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence in being.   This sentence is to commence forthwith.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:35am [mo]
Defendant Shane D Hiley in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Amended Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses the alcohol fine enhancer on Count #1
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Hiley

On Amended Count #1, The Court sentences Mr. Hiley to  7  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  4  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. Consecutive to any sentence in being.   This sentence is to commence forthwith.   

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives  1   day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Drivers Lisence and agent approval
--no presence in bars, taverns, and liquor stores
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to comply with DNA sample provision to DOC or designee upon demand
--To pay fine of $4700 + costs= $6722 + $250 DNA Surcharge= $6972 + $56.74 Blood Testing Costs=$7028.74
--To pay Court appointed attorney fees


Conditions not of Extended Supervision: 
--6 demerit points assessed
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 9:09am
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on February 16/17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on February 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 1:52 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Shane D Hiley in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Huebner: Requests matter be set for trial
Court informs parties that preliminary hearing has not yet been held
Recess: 1:53 pm Reconvene: 1:56 pm for Atty Huebner to complete paperwork

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Hiley waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending & that the deadline for entry of plea on this matter is 2/10/15
Recess: 1:59 pm

NEXT: (1) FSSC scheduled for 2/10/15 at 10:30 am - Send notices (2) JT scheduled for 2/16-17/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on December 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 3, 2014 at 10:40 am.

Defendant Shane D Hiley in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties
Atty Huebner requests matter be set for DA PTC & STC
Court reminds Mr. Hiley that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Court reminds Mr. Hiley of his Court ordered Atty fees
Recess: 9:33 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC 12/3/14 at 10:40 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 12/18/14 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
The Court appoints Attorney Huebner as counsel, repayment order of $30 a month starting 11-15-14

Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:55 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Shane D Hiley appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that they have not yet determined if Mr. Hiley is eligible for SPD Services, presents basis
Court finds proceedings are sight & sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; maximum penalties recited; reading waived
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Count #1
Bond arguments by Counsel

Court requires a $2500 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-  Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 10/23/14 at 2:30 pm if cash has been posted. If bond is posted after 10/23/14, then Mr. Hiley is to report to COC as soon as released to obtain date/time for installation.
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  Not to drive

Court informs parties that It will set preliminary hearing within 10 days

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 10.24.14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
